column4: sudo e2fsck -b 8193 /dev/sdb not working... any ideas on recovering a superblock error for a root drive in ext2?
yes tried that too :( ... I'm googling
try sdb2 and sdb3 and so on, parted can show you the partition table of it
thanks I'll give it a try
thanks, used gparted and found out that drive uses ext3
not yet, I'm having gparted check the drive
since the usb drive is'nt mounted that should be okay
gave me more data, as the fsck didn't run as noted earlier... here's the result http://pastebin.com/f40a34f7d
clearing oprphaned inode still running.  hope this works *fingers crossed*
thanks!  the fsck.ext3 command has fixed the problem and allowed me to mount the root on the usb drive.  Thanks so much
np, glad it worked for you
